alert.note: Alert for Amite (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of St. Helena, northwestern Livingston, East Feliciana, west central Tangipahoa, northeastern East Baton Rouge Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and south central Amite Counties through 400 PM CDT... At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Darlington, or 8 miles east of Clinton, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Denham Springs, Clinton, Greensburg, Walker, Livingston, Independence, Slaughter, Wilson, Norwood, Montpelier, Watson, Darlington, Pride, Felps, Greenwell Spring and Shenandoah. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 9 and 19. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 39 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
